alert.note: Alert for Howell; Oregon; Ozark (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 2:32PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Howell and Oregon. In southwest Missouri, Ozark. * WHEN...Until 700 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 227 PM CST, Rain gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional moderate rain is continuing over the advisory area, but additional heavier rain this evening could worsen any flooding potential. - This includes the following low water crossings... Lick Creek at County Road 528, Warm Fork Spring River at County Road 323, Spring Creek at County Road 349, Howell Creek at County Road 9790 and Possum Walk Creek at Highway T. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Thayer, Alton, Gainesville, Bakersfield, South Fork, Koshkonong, Pontiac and Brandsville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
